tn.text: This is the thirtieth year of Ezekiel's life. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: the fourth month, and the fifth day of the month
tn.text: "the fifth day of the fourth month." This is the fourth month of the Hebrew calendar. The fifth day is around the end of June on Western calendars. (See:  [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
This phrase is used here to mark an important event in the story. If your language has a way for doing this, you could consider using it here.

tn.ref: I was living among the captives
tn.text: The word "I" refers to Ezekiel. "I was one of the captives"
"God showed me unusual things"

tn.ref: it was the fifth year of the exile of King Jehoiachin
tn.text: Throughout the book, Ezekiel will date his prophecies based on when the Babylonians forced Jehoiachin to leave Jerusalem.
Ezekiel speaks of himself as if he were another person. AT: "to me, Ezekiel ... upon me there" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])

tn.ref: the word of Yahweh came with power to Ezekiel
tn.text: "Yahweh spoke strongly to Ezekiel"
the name of a man (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is a river that people in Chaldea had dug to give water to their gardens. "the Chebar River"

tn.ref: the hand of Yahweh was upon him
tn.text: The word "hand" is often used to refer to someone's power or action. A person with his hand on another person has power over that other person. AT: "Yahweh was controlling him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This is the name of God that he revealed to his people in the Old Testament. See the translationWord page about Yahweh concerning how to translate this.
Ezekiel continues to describe his vision.
This is a storm that has a lot of wind.
North is the direction to your left when you look toward the sun while it is rising.

tn.ref: a great cloud with fire flashing within it
tn.text: This can be translated as a new sentence: "The storm had a very large cloud with fire flashing in it"
Possible meanings are 1) "flashing lightning" or 2) "constant lightning."

tn.ref: and brightness surrounding it and inside of it
tn.text: "and a very bright light was around the cloud and inside of it"
"bright yellow like amber" or "bright yellow" or "glowing yellow"
a hard yellow resin that is used as a beautiful decoration on jewelry
"Inside the storm"

tn.ref: was the likeness of four living creatures
tn.text: "there were things that looked like four creatures" or "there was what looked like four creatures"
"This is what the four creatures looked like"

tn.ref: they had the likeness of a man
tn.text: "the four creatures looked like people"

tn.ref: but they had four faces each, and each of the creatures had four wings
tn.text: "but each of them had four different faces and four wings." Each creature had a face on the front, a face on the back, and a face on each side of its head.
Ezekiel continues to describe his vision.

tn.ref: but the soles of their feet were like the hooves of a calf
tn.text: "but their feet looked like calf hooves" or "but their feet looked like the feet of calves"
the hard part of a calf's foot
"that were shiny like bronze that has been polished." This describes the feet of the creatures. AT: "and they shone like polished bronze" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
"on all four sides of their bodies"

tn.ref: For all four, their faces and wings were like this
tn.text: "For all four of the creatures, their wings and their faces were like this"

tn.ref: and they did not turn as they went
tn.text: "and the creatures did not turn as they moved"
Ezekiel continues to describe his vision.

tn.ref: The appearance of their faces was like the face of a man
tn.text: Ezekiel is describing the faces of the creatures on their front side. AT: "The faces of each creature looked like this: The face in front looked like the face of a man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: next, the face of a lion to the right
tn.text: "the face on the right side of its head looked like the face of a lion"

tn.ref: next, the face of an ox to the left
tn.text: "the face on the left side of its head looked like the face of an ox"

tn.ref: finally, the face of an eagle
tn.text: "finally, the face on the back of its head looked like the face of an eagle"

tn.ref: their wings were spread out above, so that each creature had a pair of wings that touched another creature's wing
tn.text: "each creature held up two of his wings so that one wing touched the wing of the creature on one side of him, and the other wing touched the wing of the creature on the other side of him"

tn.ref: and also a pair of wings that covered their bodies
tn.text: This can be translated as a new sentence: "The other two wings of each creature covered its body"
"Each creature moved with a face looking forward"
Ezekiel continues to describe his vision.

tn.ref: looked like burning coals of fire, or like torches
tn.text: "were bright like coals in a hot fire, or like torches"

tn.ref: and there were flashes of lightning
tn.text: "and lightning came out from the fire."

tn.ref: The living creatures were moving swiftly back and forth, and they looked like lightning
tn.text: Lightning flashes and then disappears quickly, and the creatures moved from one place to another quickly. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
Ezekiel continues to tell about his vision.

tn.ref: there was one wheel on the ground beside the living creatures
tn.text: "there was one wheel on the ground by each one of the living creatures, one wheel for each direction the creatures faced"

tn.ref: This was the appearance and structure of the wheels
tn.text: "This is what the wheels looked like and how they were made"
Beryl is a kind of clear, valuable stone, often of yellow or golden color. "clear and yellow like a beryl stone" or "clear and yellow like a precious stone"

tn.ref: the four were all the same
tn.text: "all four of the wheels looked the same"

tn.ref: they looked like a wheel intersecting another wheel
tn.text: "they were made with one wheel going through another wheel"
Ezekiel continues to describe his vision.

tn.ref: they went without turning in any direction the creatures faced
tn.text: "the wheels were able to go in any of the four directions that the creatures faced"
"This is what the rims of the wheels looked like"
"the rims were very tall and awe-inspiring" or "the rims where tall and frightening"

tn.ref: for the rims were full of eyes round about
tn.text: "because the rims had very many eyes around all four of the wheels"

tn.ref: When the living creatures rose up from the earth
tn.text: The creatures were flying in the air after they left the ground. AT: "So when the creatures left the ground and went up into the air." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: the spirit of the living creature
tn.text: Possible meanings are that Ezekiel is 1) speaking of the "creatures" of verse 19 as if they were one creature, "the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels" or 2) using an idiom to speak of "the spirit of life" or "the living spirit" or 3) "the same spirit that gave life to the creatures also gave life to the wheels." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"the wheels also left the ground and went into the air"

tn.ref: Wherever the Spirit would go, they went
tn.text: The word "they" refers to the creatures.

tn.ref: the wheels rose up beside them
tn.text: "the wheels went up into the air with the living creatures"
A dome looks like a hollow ball that is cut in half. "Expansive" means very large. "a huge upside-down bowl"
inspiring crystal** - "awe-inspiring ice" or "crystal that makes people marvel when they look at it"

tn.ref: stretched out over their heads above
tn.text: "and the expansive dome was spread out above the heads of the creatures" or "and the expansive dome took up a lot of space over the heads of the creatures"
"under the dome"

tn.ref: Each of the living creatures also had a pair to cover themselves; each had a pair to cover his own body
tn.text: "Each of the living creatures also had two other wings, which they used to cover their bodies"
Ezekiel continues to tell about his vision of the living creatures.

tn.ref: Then I heard the sound of their wings. Like the noise of rushing water. Like the voice of the Almighty whenever they moved. Like
tn.text: Other possible meanings are that the words "whenever they moved" refer to 1) all the words before them in this verse, "Whenever they moved, I heard the sound of their wings. Like the noise of rushing water. Like the voice of the Almighty. Like" (see UDB), or 2) to the words that follow, "wings. Like the noise of rushing water. Like the voice of the Almighty. Whenever they moved, it sounded like."

tn.ref: Like ... water. Like ... moved. Like ... rainstorm. Like ... army.
tn.text: These sentences are not complete because Ezekiel was showing that he was excited about what he saw. They can be translated as complete sentences: "The wings sounded like ... water. They sounded like ... moved. They sounded like ... rainstorm. They sounded like ... army." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
This simply means "a lot of water." It could refer to "a loud river" or "a large waterfall" or "the waves crashing at the ocean". All of these are very loud.

tn.ref: Like the voice of the Almighty
tn.text: The Bible sometimes refers to thunder as "the voice of the Almighty." AT: "It sounded like the voice of the Almighty God" or "It sounded like the thunder of the Almighty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Like the sound of a rainstorm
tn.text: Possible meanings are: 1) "Like the sound of very big storm" or 2) "Like the sound of a very large crowd of people" AT: "There was a sound that was loud like a big storm" or "There was a sound that was loud like a very large crowd of people"
"Whenever the creatures stopped moving"
"the creatures let their wings hang down by their sides." They did this when they were not using their wings to fly.

tn.ref: A voice came from above the dome
tn.text: "Someone who was above the dome spoke." If you need to tell whose voice this is, you should probably identify it as the voice of Yahweh ([[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:3]]).
"the dome that was over the heads of the creatures"
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:22|1:23]].
"over the heads of the living creatures"

tn.ref: was the appearance of a throne
tn.text: "was something that looked like a throne"
a very valuable stone that is clear blue and very shiny
"on the throne there was"

tn.ref: the appearance of one who looked like a man
tn.text: "someone who looked like a man" or "someone who looked like person." If you need to tell who this is, you should probably identify him as Yahweh ([[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:3]]).
Ezekiel continues to tell about the vision.
The person's body above the hips looked like glowing metal that had fire in it.
"all around the person sitting on the throne"

tn.ref: from his hips downward it looked like fire and brightness all around
tn.text: "All around him below the hips, I saw what looked like fire and a bright light."

tn.ref: It looked like a rainbow that appears in the clouds on a rainy day, and like bright light surrounding it
tn.text: "The brightness that was all around him looked like a rainbow that appears in the clouds on a day when it rains."
the colorful strip of light that appears in the rain when the sun shines from behind the viewer

tn.ref: This appeared as the likeness of the glory of Yahweh
tn.text: "The bright light looked like something that was similar to the glory of Yahweh."

"I bowed down to the ground" or "I lay on the ground." Ezekiel did not fall by accident. He went down to the ground to show that he respected and feared Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The word "voice" is a metonym for the person. AT: "I heard someone speaking" or "Someone spoke, and I hear his voice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
